required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Isolation of Cells From Biopsy Tissue to Aid in Kidney Repair
clinical_study.official_title: Isolation of Cells From Biopsy Tissue to Aid in Kidney Repair

brief_summary.textblock: Endothelial progenitor cells that reside in renal vasculature may be stimulated to initiate differentiation programs during episodes of injury. It is hypothesized that endothelial progenitor cells resident in the kidney can transition to a post-injury phenotype that promotes endothelial repair.

detailed_description.textblock: Endothelial dysfunction is central to the pathophysiology of vascular ischemia, bacterial sepsis, toxin-induced thrombotic microangiopathy, and antibody-mediated kidney transplant rejection and often manifest with renal failure. With each of these diagnoses circulating components of the complement cascade bind to endothelial cells and induce disease progression through anaphylactic cellular messaging, monocyte homing, and direct cell membrane disruption. In response to injury during embryologic development avascular metanephric blastema initiate endothelial differentiation. Although circulating hematopoietic progenitor cells have shown therapeutic promise they incorporate into renal vasculature at very low density.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Consecutive patients will be consented to obtain kidney biopsy material.

primary_outcome.description: Tissue will be isolated and cell viability will be documented with a microscope

secondary_outcome.description: Isolated cell growth will be compared to serum creatinine of patients

arm_group.description: Patients will have kidney biopsy designated for cell isolation and culture.

intervention.description: Tissue from kidney biopsy will be used to isolate Cluster Differentiation 34+ cells.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Only patients who have a clinical indication for kidney biopsy will be considered.
- All subjects will be at least 18 years of age and may be of any gender.
- Patients undergoing a native or kidney transplant biopsy will be considered.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients not undergoing a kidney biopsy will be excluded.
